clues: The most common dress worn by married women in Chhatisgarh.
A dance primarily done by the Yadavs on Mandai and Deepavali

A flower that is very holy to the people of Chhattisgarh.
It is the most common ingredient for alcohol

The art form in which performers recite the stories from Mahabharata, predominantly Bheem.
It is dominant in Bastar
It is a dance form primarily done by the Satnami Tribe while celebrating or praying to Bheem Baba

A festival where the most number of sweet shops open up in Chhattisgarh.
This festival is now celebrated primarily in villages where the Sarpanch takes the flag (a representative of the Gods) around the village

The most famous temple in Chhattisgarh.
This temple has the remains of Gond land.
It is also called as Chhattisgarh's khajurao.

The most famous festival in Chhattisgarh.
A rath yatra takes place on this day.
The rath is decorated with Mahua and Mango leaves

A steamed dish made of rice flour made from new rice.
It is shaped like cyclindrical rolls.
